ex: Jeannie stuid anent him, fair pecht
The Fisk Secretar-depute will the day set furth new wittins anent the proponed tax exemptions
Ye ken better as that
I’ll need tae pack mair as that if I’m gaun for the week

en: through the house, towards the inner part
ex: It’s yersel! Come awa ben the hoose
Ye can only win ben a Discord server by gate o an invite URL

en: through toward the outer part of the house

ex: I’ll see ye efter!
Ar ye for gaun oot efter?
We ar wirkin nou wi aw pairt-takars for tae deliver on the ettles that’s intil the policy

def: the mucklest amoont, the lairgest nummer, the majority
ex: Oot o the lot o us I’d haen the maist beers
Maist o the dishes wis duin

def: for tae shaw surprise or that ye’r aw het up anent something
ex: Michty me!
Michty, what a weather!

inf: Ane is aften uised the day as an adjective (as weel as bein the cardinal nummer ane), whauras in traditional spoken Modren Scots ye’r mair likely tae hear ae (also pronounced ‘yae’) as the adjective. Ane wis typically the written adjective in Aulder Scots

def: {{ Exclamation shawin mild irritation or afore sayin sowt reassurin or self-effacin }}
ex: Och, naw, I dinnae speak muckle German
Och, dinnae fash, ye’ll be fine!

en: beyond the control or capabilities of

ex: I ken whit ye mean
I stey in the wast end o Edinburgh

inf: til is whiles uised only afore vouels and the letter h, and aften no afore verbs
ex: I walkit ower and spak til him
Jamie wis in a swither aboot what Hogmanay perty tae gang til
Rax me ane o thae ile filters, wad ye?
Lat’s hae a blether aboot thae twa issues ye brocht up in the meetin
Ye maun can dae better than that!

or: thair self, thar self, thair sell

ex: Resources haes been allocate tae thaim that’s maist in need
Dae ye hae anither ane o thir?
The’r ower muckle guid stuff on TV thir days that I hinna the time tae watch it aw

en: cite as pertinent, quote as evidence

ex: Richt, I’m aff!
Ye’ll need tae tak the hub caps aff
I’m a lang gate aff yet
He parked the car aff tae the side
Aw students is allocate £100 o prent credit at the stert o ilka semester
Resources haes been allocate tae thaim that’s maist in need
He awes a flat in Glesca
For years he aucht a simmer hoose in Fraunce
He haed tae sell nearhaund aw that he wis aucht
I’m aye awin ye some siller for the messages, na?
He struts aboot like he awns the place
She’s the awner o the estate

gr: present singular neg o v tae be
third person present singular o v tae be
third person present singular neg o v tae be
present singular an plural o v tae be
present singular an plural neg o v tae be

ex: Whiles we will cast-ower the policy an mak mair recommends

en: agree, coincide or fit in with

def: tae think on, tak intil accoont

ex: He contraired the new regulations the Pairlament haed pitten intae law

en: to fail to fulfil an obligation or pay a debt

ex: The professor demitit frae the post
Hibs war defeat by Hearts in the Cup final on Seturday
Aaron wis depute tae cover for his manager at the comatee meetin

def: a sype (o watter or ither liquid)
tae hing doun frae a waw wi your airms raxed oot abuin ye, syne drap tae the grund

ex: The Green Pairty convener wis ettlin tae appynt a depute by the end o the simmer
The app’s uiser interface is juist what the client’s ettlin efter
She’d ettelt sair tae pass aw her exams
He tried tae evite bein liftit by the polis

gr: neg third person singular o v tae gae etc.
neg pt o v tae gae etc.
third person singular o v tae gae etc.
neg third person singular o gie
third person singular o v tae gie

pp o the v tae dae, div

or: this uissage first appears in Late Middle Scots
ex: The pub wis mair thrang than they’d jaloused it wad be
I jaloused I’d better haud ma tongue!

def: v copy data frae ae computer system til anither, for ordinar ower the internet; n the data (file) dounlaidit

ex: The regulations effeir til hoose biggin
The comatee spak anent maiters effeirin til halth policy

def: mak a body or thing dae something

The court gart the company provide mair wittins
The 1992 Chairter gies bield til Europe’s regional or smaw leids

en: keep to a path or route
ex: I jaloused I’d better haud ma tongue!
The neist comatee meetin will be hauden in Mey

en: be obliged or required to do something
continue to improve (e.g. in health, or in terms of the degree of one’s accomplishment at performing a given job, task or craft)

A new pipe netwark inbrocht watter tae the hoose

en: alter or revise (established practice or the status quo)
ex: She aye likit tae innovate in her wark

inf: Uisses the day are limitit tae Scots law — aft-times in the phrase interpone authority to — but it wis uised mair braidly in Aulder Scots

ex: I ken brawly richt bi wrang!
I kenna what ye mean — ye’r haiverin, mun!

Tammas kentna what tae dae

gr: adj, an ptp o v tae ken
ex: Brian is a weel kent face on the Edinburgh jazz scene
Lat’s hae a drink efter wark
I wadna lat it fash ye
The wather’s nice the noo but I dout it winna lest!
The CEO luit skairhauders speir at him efter the meetin
John haed been luiten doun by his colleague
Mak compare atween the twa documents for tae unnerstaund the differs
Ye maun be jokin!
He maunna hae been able tae come
The essay maunna be ower 3,000 wirds

def: v copy data frae ae computer system til anither, for ordinar til a server, an aften ower the internet; n the data (file) uplaidit

ex: Dinna fash yersel
I wis sair fasht aboot the job interview
I wadna lat it fash ye
The report recommendit we fesh-on a national policy
I’v fund the new season tae be awfie slaw

def: tae steid or stert the biggin o a kirk, tour, toun etc.
tae visit aften or oot o habit
tae associate wi, meet up wi

ex: Ye dinna need tae greet aboot it!
The film haed me greetin

ex: Dae ye hae anither ane o thir?

gr: neg o the v tae hae, hiv

neg present singular o the v tae hae, hiv
pt o the v tae hae, hiv

gr: neg pt o the v tae hae, hiv
pp o the v tae hae, hiv

or: Middle English an Early Modren English

def: law pit forrit or state (a plea) in a court

or: Auld English tacan frae the Auld Norse taka
ex: The roaster’s comment haed been taen doun afore I could repone til him

gr: pres participle o the v tae tak

ex: The Chairter wis taen on in 1992

en: to unwind yarn, thread etc. from a reel

def: streetch oot for tae claucht something
ex: Rax me ane o thae ile filters, wad ye?

He raxed his craig for tae see what wis gaun on

or: frae the noun or a reduced mak o Anglo-Norman
Aulder Scots haes furthset ‘tae set furth or forrit; tae advance’ an furthsettar, furthsetter
ex: She haes setten furth a pose o unco bonnie poyetry

en: walk in a clumsy or shuffling manner

ex: Mind and steek the yett ahint ye

Dinna swither, min — haud gaun!
or: doutsome; first kythes (as a verb) in Middle Scots

ex: Clap the button for tae wale oot a wird allevolie

ex: Ye wadna could tell he uised tae be in the airmy

Juist in your ain time, likes!

def: o the weather, the temperatur: fell cauld

ex: The benner room wis buskit braw

en: having been hit or kicked hard

ex: It wis a gey and braw day

en: relating to the parlour or best room

ex: They haed a cantie efternuin in the beer gairden

def: o the weather, the temperatur: (fell) cauld

ex: Contrair til expectations, he did weel in his exams

He’s a ill-naiturt an contrair chiel
He’s as daft as a yett in a windy day
It’s gey dreich this efternuin

en: the more easterly of two places
def: locatit tae the east; the mair easter o twa steids, biggins or ither things; kythes in steid names, e.g. Easter Road

def: o a colour somegate atween black and white

ex: It’s gey het ootside

def: apointit as, or exercein the duties o, depute

en: of high rank or social standing

ex: I’m feelin no weel the day

en: of weather boisterous, uncertain, gusty with rain

ex: They’r frae Dundee if I mind richt

My back’s been sair for a week noo

def: relatit by bluid, strynd or mairiage

ex: Ay, I wadna trust the sleekit bastart!

en: the more westerly of two places

I ken brawly richt bi wrang!

en: in or towards the outer part of a house, kitchen or outer room
in (or to) both the outer and inner parts

ex: He chynged the contents o the file ’ithout takkin a backup, contrair til best prattick

What she wantit maist o aw wis a vacance

They focht michtily

en: to a large extent or degree

ex: Haud on, I’ll no be a meenit

ex: I’v nae heard that sang afore

or: the day first appears in scrievit form in Aulder Scots frae aboot 1500
the morn(e) ‘the follaein day’ dates back til aboot 1470
ex: I'll see ye the morn!

ex: Haud on; I’ll be there the noo
I cawed her the noo but she wisna answerin

My neebour up the stair telt me
The airtins ablo gang intil mair detail

def: the (stey or sclentin) banks o a river, loch or seashore
a bank or lenth o grund wi a fairly strait upwart sclent til it

ex: We can hoose the kye in the byre the nicht

def: a bit claith, rag, dishclaith, patch
an enclosed area neist til a biggin; a courtyaird
a nairae loan wi hoosees on ilka side
the passage gien ingate til a common stair; the mean area in a block o flats

or: unkent, but mak compare wi Auld French complote, ‘a raivelt thrang o fowk’

en: law a sum paid in settlement of a claim, dispute or obligation; the amount fixed by mutual agreement
a piece of writing; a work of literature, music or art

def: tae endure; tae thole pyne and ill sonse

ex: I’v haed juist aboot eneuch o your haiverin

or: Aulder Scots haes the verb enveron, inviroun, inveroun (to encircle, surroond)

or: noun isna fund in Aulder Scots

inf: The ‘l’ at the end o the Aulder Scots spellins (sic as ‘futebal’) is what’s kent as a ‘vouel lenth merker’ and wadna aye hae been soondit

ex: They pit doun the foonds o the biggin

def: the product o a tree or ither plant that haes seeds intil’t, an can be etten as fuid
revenue accressed frae the crap o the laund

a street (in a toun); kythes aft-times in steid names

ex: She felt better for hivin haed a guid greet

en: a person or animal given to roaming about

ex: I’m awa hame

def: the chyngin o an estaiblisht mak, wey o daein things or institution
law the chyngin or replacement o a legal servitude or provision

def: an unpedmentit or girssie track for cattle; aft-times in steid names
the ferm gate airtin til the fermhoose
a natural-formed area o watter surroundit by laund (rangin in bouk frae muckle doun til lairge pownds); aft-times in street names

ex: That’s aa I hiv tae sae aboot the maiter!

en: the action or process of manufacturing (an object) or developing (a character)

ex: He poued the pleuch wi aw his micht

def: the mind; that whilk is brocht back tae mind or mindit, memory, a mindin

def: a boorach o fowk, bease or objects croudelt close thegither

ex: She wis awfu unweel wi the pneumonie

or: a Modren Scots coinage; Aulder Scots haes the verb retere, reteir, frae the Middle French

ex: It wis naething but tuim rhetoric

def: a braid route atween twa steids
or: SND states that the mak road (frae Auld English rād) is a 16t century borraein frae English, the historical Scots mak bein raid

def: a body that haivers, fashes fowk wi their ill laits, or is thocht tae be makkin an idiot o theirsels

ex: He wis saufed frae seekness and frae sair

en: a relative, or kinsman or kinswoman

ex: I’ll send ye the siller

or: steer ‘tae steer, gie airt til’ wi -ar suffix. Baith -ar an -er kythe on the SLC wabsite. Waled -ar here by analogy wi co-airtar, pairt-takar and lawmakar

en: a state of indecision or doubt
a state of nervousness or agitation
ex: Jamie wis in a swither aboot what Hogmanay perty tae gang til

I wis hinkin I’d gie the perty a miss gin it’s awricht wi yoursel

def: an area wi a name and boonds whaur fowk haes sattelt

anent Albainie, its fowk, or their leid
anent Bulgairie, its fowk, or their leid

or: Canady, Canadie syne at least the 19t century
Cheena syne at least the mid-19t century

Czechie is a Modren Scots protologism o Česko, a new official name for Česká republika; -ae and -y/-ie steid-name endins shaws Dutch and French influence, vs -a or -ia (meanin ‘land’ or ‘steid’) that English haes borraed frae the Laitin

anent Denmark, its fowk, or their leid

anent Freishland, its fowk, or their leid

anent Italy, its fowk, or their leid

anent Swaiden, its fowk, or their leid

a country in Great Britain that is pairt o the Unitit Kinrick

def: Gie me, gie us (contraction o ‘gie us’)
